Inference: Temperature-modulated leak severity estimation
Description: When leak detections coincide with rising moisture and temperatures near freezing or overheating, the system can classify leaks as high-risk due to thermal stress that accelerates pipe failure.
short rationale: Severity with thermal context per incident; enables detailed reconstruction and prioritization.

Inference: Distinguishing condensation-driven moisture from leak-driven moisture
Description: Moisture increases that occur at temperatures near dew point without matching leak detection entries suggest condensation, whereas moisture spikes at normal pipe temperatures alongside leak detections indicate real leaks.
short rationale: Separates condensation vs. leaks; moderate context sensitivity without strong identity exposure.

Inference: Freeze-related leak identification
Description: Leak detection events that occur shortly after pipe temperatures rise from sub-freezing suggest freeze-thaw bursts, especially when accompanied by rapid moisture increases.
short rationale: Freeze-related events with timing; high incident specificity.

Inference: Predicting imminent leaks from temperature trends
Description: Sustained low temperatures followed by early moisture elevation and eventual leak detection form a predictive pattern indicating that cold-induced leaks were developing before detection.
short rationale: Precursor pattern tied to time/zone; supports forecasting, moderate sensitivity.

Inference: Filtering out false leak detections using temperature
Description: Leak detections that occur at normal or stable temperatures with no preceding thermal stress and minimal moisture increase may represent false positives.
short rationale: Flags false positives lacking thermal/moisture corroboration; low privacy impact.

Inference: Characterizing slow cold-weather seepage
Description: Low temperatures combined with gradually rising moisture that later results in leak detection indicate slow seepage caused by shrinkage of fittings in cold weather.
short rationale: Cold-weather seepage characterization with timing; moderate incident detail.

Inference: Distinguishing hot-water leaks from cold-water leaks
Description: Leak detections accompanied by moisture spikes and elevated temperatures indicate hot-water leaks, whereas normal or low temperatures suggest cold-water circuit leaks.
short rationale: Attributes circuit type; some location/system insight but limited personal data.

Inference: Thermal impact on moisture spread rate
Description: After a leak is detected, moisture spread tends to be faster at higher temperatures due to reduced viscosity, while cold temperatures slow spread; analyzing temperature with moisture reveals propagation dynamics.
short rationale: Analytical spread modeling; low incident specificity.

Inference: Silent thermal stress detection via moisture and temperature alignment
Description: Moisture increases that occur as temperatures fluctuate near critical limits, even without immediate leak detection, indicate silent thermal damage developing in pipes.
short rationale: Pre-failure signals tied to temperature; moderate sensitivity.

Inference: Assessing leak criticality by combining thermal and moisture peaks
Description: Leaks occurring during extreme temperatures and producing rapid moisture surges can be classified as more critical than leaks occurring at mild temperatures with gradual moisture rise.
short rationale: Criticality ranking using temperature and moisture peaks; incident-focused but limited identity exposure.

Inference: Evaluating leak sensor timing using temperature cues
Description: If moisture rises sharply while temperature shows extreme conditions but leak detection happens late, the leak sensor is detecting too slowly under thermal stress.
short rationale: Operational timing gap analysis; moderate incident timeline exposure.

Inference: Temperature-based localization refinement
Description: When a leak occurs, comparing temperature gradients and moisture activation order helps refine the physical location of the leak, especially when multiple leak detections fire.
short rationale: Pinpoints leak location using gradients/timing; high reconstruction and location sensitivity.

Inference: Identifying leaks masked by condensation in cold zones
Description: Cold temperatures can cause condensation that masks early leak-related moisture; when temperature rises and moisture persists or leak detection fires, leakage becomes distinguishable from condensation.
short rationale: Distinguishes condensation vs. leak in cold zones with timing; location-sensitive.

Inference: Thermal progression patterns for incident classification
Description: Different types of leaks show characteristic temperature–moisture–detection sequences, forming fingerprints such as freeze bursts (cold → moisture → leak) or overheating failures (hot → leak → moisture).
short rationale: Pattern library for classification; moderate incident detail.

Inference: Detecting leaks in thermally insulated segments
Description: Leak detections with moisture spikes but minimal temperature change indicate leaks in insulated or buried segments where thermal signals are dampened.
short rationale: Reveals hidden/insulated leak locations; event-specific.

Inference: Identifying false moisture readings using leak and temperature data
Description: Moisture spikes at extreme temperatures with no leak detections may indicate sensor fogging or condensation rather than real water presence.
short rationale: Flags suspect moisture readings; low privacy impact beyond timestamps.

Inference: Understanding leak onset dynamics with thermal cues
Description: Some leaks begin during rapid heating or cooling transitions; aligning leak detection timestamps with temperature slope changes and moisture rise reveals causality.
short rationale: Sequence-based onset analysis; moderate incident specificity.

Inference: Temperature-triggered leak escalation identification
Description: Leaks that worsen as temperatures drop further (or rise abruptly) can be identified by correlating moisture slope acceleration with temperature extremes after the initial leak detection.
short rationale: Tracks escalation vs. temperature; moderate reconstruction detail.

Inference: Assessing repair durability under thermal stress
Description: If repairs are followed by leak recurrence only during extreme temperatures, combining moisture, leak logs, and temperature reveals that repairs fail under thermal load.
short rationale: Post-repair monitoring tied to temperature extremes; moderate timeline/location exposure.

Inference: Detecting overheating-induced gasket failures
Description: High temperatures followed by moisture rise and leak detection identify gasket or seal failures caused by overheating rather than mechanical damage.
short rationale: Overheating seal failure classification; limited personal inference.

Inference: Cross-validating leak detection quality across temperature ranges
Description: If leak detections only occur at moderate temperatures but moisture and thermal patterns suggest leaks at extremes, detection sensitivity varies across operating temperatures.
short rationale: Sensor performance check by temperature band; low privacy impact.

Inference: Identifying multi-stage thermal-leak events
Description: Events showing temperature fluctuation → moisture onset → delayed leak detection represent multi-stage failures where thermal stress first weakens materials before leakage becomes detectable.
short rationale: Multi-stage pattern with timing; high reconstruction value for incidents and zones.

Inference: Temperature-governed dry-out behavior after leaks
Description: Moisture decay after a leak is strongly temperature-dependent; combining leak logs with thermal context explains why some zones dry quickly and others remain damp.
short rationale: Post-incident drying analysis; moderate sensitivity.

Inference: Differentiating appliance-related leaks using temperature
Description: Hot-water appliance leaks show distinct temperature elevation during leak detection, whereas structural cold-water leaks maintain ambient pipe temperatures.
short rationale: Attributes leaks to appliances vs. structure; reveals appliance use timing.

Inference: Thermal hotspot leak localization
Description: When a leak is detected, the warmest or coldest nearby sensor combined with moisture spike timing often identifies the exact failing pipe section.
short rationale: Localizes failure to specific section via thermal/moisture cues; high location sensitivity.
